title.native: ダンジョンに出会いを求めるのは間違っているだろうかⅣ 深章 厄災篇
title.romaji: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka IV: Shin Shou Yakusai-hen
title.english: Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? IV Part 2

description:
The second cour of the fourth season of Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka.

Bell and Ryu end up in the 37th floor, which is a Deep Floor. The rest of the party are at level 27, facing the level boss Amphisbaena. They have to defeat the level boss, in order to save Bell. At the same time, Bell and Ryu have to find a way to stay alive on a floor with strong monsters while having to avoid the Juggernaut.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: มันผิดรึไงถ้าใจอยากจะพบรักในดันเจี้ยน ภาค 4 Part 2
Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka 4th Season Part 2
Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? Season 4 Part 2

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujinoomori)

Fujino Oomori is a Japanese author most known for writing the [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) light novel series. 

In early 2013, [Danmachi](https://anilist.co/manga/85162/Is-It-Wrong-to-Try-to-Pick-Up-Girls-in-a-Dungeon/) was submitted to the 4th GA Bunko Award, where it won and received an offer to have it published by Bunko.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

__[Website](https://whv-amusic.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sajounohana)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sajounohana/)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JPN_sajou-no-hana-192527894722117/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCleWyL3f1xJU3Huj7NzRE5Q)__

__Formed:__ 2018
__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative), Shoegazer, Anison

__Biography:__
sajou no hana is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label Warner Brothers Home Entertainment (2018-). Their singer initially debuted in 2016 as the vocalist of the seiyuu collaboration [MOB CHOIR](https://anilist.co/staff/161167/Mob-Choir) under the name 37, who performed the opening theme to the first season of [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/Mob-Psycho-100/).

__Members:__
- [sana](https://anilist.co/staff/296329) (さな) - vocalist
- [Sho Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/109345) (渡辺翔) - keyboardist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming
- [Tatsuya Kitani](https://anilist.co/staff/161639/Tatsuya-Kitani) (キタニタツヤ) - guitarist and bassist, in-charge of lyrics, composition, arrangement and programming

(Source: [Wikipedia (sajou no hana)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sajou_no_hana), edited)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Elisanne (Dragalia Lost)
- Kamisato Ayaka (Genshin Impact)
- Munechika (Utawarerumono)
- Pramanix (Arknights)
- Rei Shijo (Princess Connect! Re:Dive)
- Tao Isonokami (Shin Megami Tensei V)
- Vector (Girls' Frontline)
- Shimakaze (Azur Lane)
- Kirifuji Nagisa (Blue Archive)
- Kunimitsu II (Tekken 7)
- Emma Millstein (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Hulkenberg (Metaphor: ReFantazio)
- Caeda (Fire Emblem Heroes)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/111209/)._

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

More recently she has also been involved in storyboarding and episode directing.
Kouno Shinya (河野眞也) is a Japanese animator and animation director.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).
